titleStmt.title: Despatch from Theodore A. Rosenbush to Bancroft Davis, July 24, 1869

bibl.title: Despatch from Theodore A. Rosenbush to Bancroft Davis, July 24, 1869
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

correspAction.persName: Davis, J. C. Bancroft (John Chandler Bancroft), 1822-1907

div1.p: Commercial Agency of the United States of America at Sierra Leone 24th July 1869.

I have the honor to report to you for the Department's information the appearance, on the 30th ultimo, in this port of an American Sloop called the "Champion" of 30 31/100 Tons measurement of Noank, Connecticut; The Captain, William W. Cox, arrived at the Isle de Loss, according to his report coming from Goree, without another soul but himself on board, he stated to me that
H. B. Davis Esqre
Assistant Secretary
Washington, D.C.
that in landing near Goree his Boat capsized and he lost his Ship's papers, however, he deposited with me a properly authenticated power to sell the Sloop. The Crew list he stated was lost and his crew had deserted.
The case looks suspicious to me and I report it for your investigation.

Captain Cox was very anxious to put the Sloop under British Colors but not being able to propose a bona fide process I refused to do so. He has left this port on the 21st instant; destination Isle de Loss.

I have the honor to be,
Sir,
Your obedient Servant,
Rosenbush.
U.S. Vice Comml Agt:
